thread.title: Every move goes awry as Astros fall to Royals 5-4 in ALDS
thread.title_full: Every move goes awry as Astros fall to Royals 5-4 in ALDS

author: DAVE SKRETTA AP Sports Writer
title: Every move goes awry as Astros fall to Royals 5-4 in ALDS
text: Every move goes awry as Astros fall to Royals 5-4 in ALDS Associated Press | 0 comments KANSAS CITY, Mo. — Every move Houston Astros manager A.J. Hinch made seemed tdo work in Game 1 of the AL Division Series. Every move he tried in Game 2 seemed to go awry. The Kansas City Royals took advantage, rallying from a three-run hole for a 5-4 victory Friday that evened their series at a game apiece as it shifts to Houston. "We didn't execute," Hinch said. "That's baseball." It didn't work when Hinch pulled starter Scott Kazmir in the sixth inning, as Oliver Perez and the rest of the Astros bullpen melted down, allowing Kansas City to score twice and knot the game 4-all. kA 4=2DDlQAbQm}@C H96? w:?49 AF==65 9:D @FE7:6=56CD :?
